google_play_reviews.content: Smoothest reader
If RSS is not available it could just upload the feed from (chosen) social media accounts. Otherwise it's a good customizable news app.
massive bugs
I am using this reader . This is fast . Other things is best. Show thamnail . Make feeds addable manually like as YouTube channel, YouTube playlists also.
It works perfectly. It is small, free (and open source for people who would like to modify it). It is easy to set up. No account needed. Attractive interface
Simple, does its job efficiently. Watches the websites you tell it to, and alerts you when they post something new. A harkening to the glory of the age of blogs a decade ago.
A reminder of the era when the Web thronged with busy personal websites. This checks the sites you specify and and alerts when they update. _Very_ handy and works flawlessly.
Decent Rss too bad Google forced this dev to abandon the project. Needs a tagging system for saved articles. Handy Reader is the spiritual successor to Flym.
Ad free, free rss reader, works very well while no other apps seem to, go figure.

I really WANTED to like this app, because I was specifically looking for open-source ad-free options. Unfortunately, I couldn't get it to pull data from any feed not already in its database, and even those seem spotty. I tried to look up support info, but the repo has been archived and the app has been abandoned, so all I know is that this is a very common problem. Even if it were working, the interface is vague and clumsy, and it doesn't check the feed before adding a URL. Can't recommend :(
Great app. Would be nice to have an Android widget too.
Finally a great RSS reader with notifications and offline reading with image caching.
Love this app!
Trash

It is the most practical rss reader and it pulls all images from the sources unlike many others that leave an ugly blank placement; unfortunately due to Google new restrictions the dev had to archive it... 😞
Exactly what I was looking for. Clean AMOLED interface, EASY keyword filtering, open in external default browser, no creepy tracking. awesome!

Love the simple interface, but 80% of the feeds I've added are broken. Maybe RSS is just not maintained anymore but these are presented in the app when you search for keywords so those need to be cleaned up for the app to be usable.
Have to click on All and back to Unread to see updates. Not a very pleasant interface
Thanks Julian for this app
Otter RSS, StaRSS, Fox RSS and this one. You won't ever need another one. Those 4 are the best ones to this day. Trust me. I'm also glad RSS ain't 100% dead, even if not as popular anymore :)
Heard about Flym on Python Bytes... exactly what I've been looking for.

Trying to like this app. It does have search, that's a plus. Interface is okay. Increase size type excellent. Does not pull in most feeds identical I have functioning in feedly. Fail. Set up is very tedious with too much clicking about. Deleting feed ??? App not at all intuitive imo.
Did exactly what I needed - RSS with notifications. Bye bye Twitter. Thanks!
Love it, but could you add the news to change to read when scroll up?
never seen a ad
Amazing rss reader, works well on my chromebook. The only thing is mouse scroll is working for entries, but not working for content, but it is understandable, cause app is made for mobile.
The best news aggregator I've found. Still having a hard time getting the offline mode to behave correctly, but otherwise perfect.
Excellent. Great replacement for defunct SmartNews. All it needs is an Offline mode.

Lot good but several serious issues. Does not refresh on open despite setting. Once refreshed new articles can not be seen until you change list views (new/all/back again). Usually fails to show content in reader view. No toolbar in browser view so disjointed using OS back button at bottom then app back button at top to return to list. Big bright colored squares next to every article is largely pointless and needs option to hide. Some times a feed is full of spam ad links.

The best rss feed that I've found on playstore easy to choose feeds, easy setup, small size with no ads...it shows a notification that you have new articles, but has the same problem like other rss feeds where are the push notifications that display the news feed in my notification area or home screen like a Google news widgets or just a tab for even 10 to 30 seconds.. Get me interested in the actual feed not take me back to the app to read..
Very good. No nonsense rss reader. I wish it had some additional sorting options, like shuffle or by topic rather than just by feed source.
Great, simple, free and ad-free (!) RSS reader. Really can't fault it. Would love an option for a serif based article font though
The perfect lean open source news reader app. There's not much I could have asked for -- it has all the features I need and none of the features I don't need.
Well done and neat!
So good and so good.this is
Better than most! No Trackers!!! Just needs an update.
Better than feedly
Works well and is fairly lightweight. Quite happy with it.
Too many dead feeds to be truly useful. Lack of a widget further reduces the usefulness of this app.

I like the idea and layout of this app but it simply doesn't parse most of the URL's added. Maybe it requires the specific RSS URL but it doesn't find these when searching. If it improves, I'll happily revisit the rating. Désolé.
Blacklist not working
I love this apps. Best rss reader ever. Thanks a lot man. I used it more than 2 Year now.

Thank you for implementing 1 of my suggestions. Others are: A) Organize feeds by alphabetical order. B) Rss search result displays feeds' readers/subscribers count & clickable feeds preview before adding feed. C) Back button opens drawer instead of exit app. E) Full text retrieval option for groups. F) Default view option: All / Unreads. G) minimize white spaces in drawer & feeds. Ty!
My favourite rss reader, ty dev :)
Straight forward, easy to use, ad free, just works!
Good news feed reader
"No items. Pull down to refresh." I do. Still no items.
Really wish this would be updated. It's an amazing app. Really a shame when great apps are abandoned. Please consider updating this on fdroid please.
Perfect.
Flym 1.x is better

Thanks for this great-looking, minimalist RSS reader. Works like a champ. My only wish is for categories/folders. When you accumulate lots of feeds, things can get messy without it. Never mind. I figured out how to create groups.
Nice free, you should make an sponsoroptiom
I would have liked to use this with The Old Reader but doesn't allow it. It fails to pick up a lot of feeds when adding new subscriptions. Ended up using FeedMe instead.
Rather useless, cannot read nearly all articles in the app.

Buttery-smooth interface. But no way to see the URL of a feed you selected from the search list. This makes it hard to tell why a feed is not being downloaded:. Update - this is just crunchy. I'm always struggling to get feeds for offline viewing.
Best and free ❤️
Thank you for this amazing app. I've been using this for years now. 🙏

Remove the user question that appears when unchecking a feed. We dont need our decisions to be checked. You kill productivity that way. Don't like sw. No memory to keep position in feed list when returning from browser; must rescroll to find where i was.
nice app, very smooth. maybe better if adding group feed for better experience
Simple app with all the functions I need for a RSS reader. Able to open article in external browser. Great app!
Excellent app, thank you.

The best RSS reader app. And it's free! But we need a one push option/button to download the feeds, which would automatically download the latest feeds at once for reading later without internet connection(aeroplane mode) so that we can continue to read while on a plane or where there's no internet. And we should be able to select which feeds to download. If implemented it would be perfect!
It does what it says on the tin and no ads.

Excellent, but is there a way to sync the feeds and the settings somewhere? I would like to sync this app on the tablet and on my phone, so whenever I read a feed on the tablet I don't find it as unread on the phone

New Android user here! Since I'm coming from Windows 10 Mobile; I was looking for an alternative to NewsFlow, the most popular RSS reader on the dying W10M platform which is free, simple to use and let's you filter text from websites so you don't have to open them in your browser. Fortunately, it looks like I finally found what I've been looking for! This app does exactly what NewsFlow does. Absolutely fantastic app that works as it should, has a very clean UI and is 100% free! 5 out of 5, easy.
No frills or fuss rss and a lot more. Exactly what's needed!
Needs a widget for 5 stars
Simple and easy. Feels like it's missing 2 features though: > Ability to toggle notifications per site or list > Open in browser of choice, not just default
Excellent. Give different number of feeds option for each feeds, like 10 for one 100 for another and published date and time option.
Overall very good. I'd like to be able to tap and hold on a link to view the URL or share it.
Simple and quick, best I could find
Wow
Best RSS reader on android. Good configuration. Great in app reader experience. Nothing more I could ask for.
add support for ctv news, quick !

Is fast and simple, great! Wishlist: - enable starting with feeds overview instead of directly showing entries from all feeds, so specific feed can quickly be clicked at start. - back button when feed entries are shown leaves the app, would be great to go to feed overview in this case (back button setting). - The font of feed entries is a bit big for my taste and is not resized with font setting. - when specific feed is selected, could the feed name and it's icon be removed from every entry?

This is it, chief. +Auto load full article +Sort by folder +Save articles +NO ADS +Removes duplicates These are all features that you will be shockingly hard-pressed to find in any other RSS feed app.

Thanks for your good work for this clean free software but it laks some useful and necessary features like marking headers as read when scrolling, adjusting viewing style of article headers, changing density of feed, changing scrolling style, recording statistics about viewed/read articles.
Such a great app. It's sad that it has been discontinued.
The refresh time setting doesn't seem to work consistently. Doesn't check every 5 minutes if set, but does check at unknown intervals.
The best ad free simple rss feed app. Design and app itself is outdated. But the simplicity and minimalism of this opensourse app is awesome.
Updated Review 4: Still love this app and use it every day. Big thanks to the Dev for keeping it free and equally important ad-free! Highly recommended!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your comment! This is actually on my to-do list, stay tuned.

google_play_reviews.content: Can u allow to open default on all feeds rather then unread. Also a way to only show certain articles from a rss with keywords. Thanks
Easy and fun to use. Beautifully designed. Highly recommend!
Poor formating and fonting of text. Struggles to load articles from each feed.
Very clean and easy to use. The best improvement would be to automatically mark items as read once they have been scrolled past. There is an issue for this on GitHub.

Simple but an excellent rss reader. Only issue : Text size feature. It doesn't work. No matter what option I pick, the text size remains "normal", which is problematic due to its large font size. Any attempt to lower the size doesn't get recognised by the app all.
The "all entries" does not actually show all entries unless we open one of the subfolders. other than that, this is just the rss reader I was looking for.

I still have to click on a link to read the full story at the target website, thus negating the relevance of this app. If I have to visit each website, then I might as well just bookmark each site and use my browser instead. 1 star until fixed.
Cannot add custom feeds
I've been looking for a good lightweight RSS reader for a while and this is perfect for what I need. Easy to use and with minimal permission requirements.

I am blind and use the Talkback screen reader on my Android phone. I have tried several RSS readers in the last few days and they have not worked well with Talkback. This app works well except for a few unlabeled buttons. If you label those buttons, I will change my rating to five instead of 4 stars.

Brilliant. Flym looks attractive and works well. It easily imported feeds from my previous reader (which has been abandoned by its developer & is no longer working properly). The range of options & flexibility allows you to set it up to suit your needs.
I replaced rss demon with this. Proof that there are still decent apps in the app store without adverts.
Just the right rss reader without intrusive adds and all basic features. My favourite is the ability to have custom searches.. I tried lot of other options and finally found this
Very good app for reading RSS feeds.

Used to replace Read rss reader which betrayed his users ("no ads for ever"... then massive update and proceed to push noisy adds each time you want to read an article) . Job is done, stable and easy to use with all the mandatory settings. Room for improvement in the UI (different display layout for instance)

Very good for my needs, especially when paired with rsshub, I can now view tweets of a group of people without having to use the awful website that is Twitter. My only complaint is I can't download images or videos directly in the app for some reason :(

Perfect for my needs. I read a lot of webserial stories that I follow using feeds, so all I need is a way to be notified of new articles (check) and open those articles straight into my browser (check) without the program itself getting too much in the way (check) and no ads (check). Flym has been quick and responsive in use without too much extraneous schtoff I don't need. Zero complaints, five stars.
Works great, thanks.
Very nice app. Able to choose the feeds I want and like the style of the app. Nice clean layout and has options to taylor suit it to your own needs.
